comment: He's a lazy professor and doesn't provide any real feedback. He just copy/paste feedback. All the exams are multiple choice so he doesn't have to grade them (again, lazy). I stopped watching his "lectures" because all he does is just read word for word from the slides (again, lazy). I can read and don't need someone to read for me. Avoid!

Lectures are nothing but reading slides, not hands on. No time showing how to do things in SQL/Access/Server/Visio but expects students to know how to do things they've never seen outside of the text examples. Text is lacking and doesn't properly prepare you for labs and assignments. Expect to spend a lot of time on YouTube. Take someone else.

The homework takes a good amount of time to do but he gives you 2 weeks to finish it. Test were easy for the most part if you had a good understating of the lesson. Always gives feedback on homework so you know what to work on.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Easy to get a hold of and responds quickly, but he didn't seem very engaged with the class. Seven homework assignments (answers found in the book), seven quizzes, seven discussion post, one team project, and one final. I wouldn't take him again unless there wasn't another option.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I really liked professor Inman he answers any questions youd have regarding the assignments or labs and was very accessible. The labs and assignments arent hard and neither was the test or quizzes. The final exam was Proctored though which was incredibly intimidating because they watch you the whole time. Other than that it was a great class.

Very hard to access outside of class. Tough grader to the point of marking several points of for a single typo. Doesn't put a whole lot of effort into lectures or assignments, and can come off as a lazy online professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Another lazily slapped together online course, and the all or nothing grading is pretty lazy too, in my opinion. It really makes you feel like what you have learned isn't valuable when the teacher blindly goes along with a pre-made rubrik, rather than truly grading it himself. The "feedback" is simply copy-pasted answers with no actual feedback.
Hes become more of a strict grader over the years. I dont recommend because hes just such a tough grader. Test are insanely easy though. Dont take for online!

Professor Inman is a really nice chill guy. The way he grades is strict though, he grades by what the book says, so it's a good idea to pay attention in class. I thought I could get by with an easy A without reading the book, but I found out that wasn't the case. As long as you attend class AND read the book, you can definitely pull off an A.

Very chill and nice dude but also a very stingy grader. He either gives full credit for a question or no credit at all. HIs lectures are on Youtube and are about as exciting as the DMV. He gives plenty of time to complete assignments (most students procrastinate). However he does respond to emails quickly and is happy to help students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mr. Inman is a great, humble man who cares about you and your grade. If you have the chance to take this course online, do it. I wish I did. 3 tests and a final that are all in-class online exams and proctored. Just read the book and do the assignments and you'll pass with an Easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM! I took him twice for the same course and made a C and B. HE IS A HORRIBLE PERSON OVERALL. I tried plenty of times trying to get in touch with him, even scheduled a meeting with him 3 times and he stood me up all those times! I did ALL OF THE WORK and he gave me a 0 for 3 major assignments WHEN I DID EVERYTHING RIGHT!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Tough grader in my opinion. A lot of labs and assignments, a few quizzes and 3 exams. If you do everything, you'll pass. Just started using a software called "Proctor U" for the final. It's now a College of Computing requirement/initiative for this online class, which kind of sucks. You're basically being watched while you test. Class was blah
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Choose Prof. Inman over any. I wish I could've taken him online. However, I took him in class and it is very easy to get an A if you do all your work. He is very caring towards his students and gives out extra credit by the end of the semester for sure. You have to be super dumb to fail this class. All in all, he is that college professor you need.

Took database systems online with him and his powerpoints and recorded lectures were very specific and helpful.  The online learning tool on ksu's website makes most if not all assignments relatively easy.  The assignments might take some time but overall the class and teacher are not very difficult.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Compare to other online classes, I like the structure of this class because he gives an actual recorded lecture than just something straight out of the powerpoint. He has a clear grading rubric and as long as you do the work then you will pass the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Iimpossibble class, with tests that are extremely picky.  He is a tough grader with no partial credit.  Do NOT take him.

Professor Inman is extremely understanding! He gives great feedback on graded assignments and really goes out of his way to help students out.  Possibly the best professor in KSU!  (Actually a pretty high chance...) If you have a choice between Professor Inman and another, choose Professor Inman.

Very straightforward class and tests. There is an assignment and lab every week, as well as a quiz. Professor Inman will always answer emails quickly and explain things to you, which is very useful as some of the explanations on the assignments were a little vague. Tests are all definitions and true false questions.

Kirk is amazing. Very understanding of students and will often times go out of his way to help. Definitely my favorite professor at KSU thus far. ANYTHING that is wrong with his class is entirely because Dr. Haddad has influence over how his class is run and writes his tests for him (which are hard). Kirk himself is awesome. He should run 2301

I really disliked this class. Not that databases are particularly interesting but Prof. Inman makes them borderline excruciating. He's a real nice guy but he isn't particularly good at teaching and I don't feel that I obtained any relevant knowledge. Mostly obscure memorization. Work is unapplicable. tests overly difficult. Would not recommend.

He is really concerned about the student knowing and understanding the course material. You must show up to class to receive attendance points. There are only two test in the class but make sure you study(you can use your notes and book for the test). Really nice guy.

This was a Hybrid class, Mr. Inman is very knowledgeable  in this subject and cared about the students understanding the material. Very patient and willing to help the student as much as possible. He answers emails promptly and responds to every question.  Great teacher

If you're taking an IT course, I highly recommend Inman. Attendance is not mandatory, but you get points for showing up, so why not? He's very passionate and knowlegable about the subject & very laid back. You can tell he cares more about students learning the material than anything, and is willing to help you out in any way he can. great professor
